name: BP07-520ED SD70ACe Coolant Pressure Sensor Replacement on a Hot Engine

steps.name: Sequence Of Job Steps [Recommended Safe Action]
steps.details: Sequence Of Job Steps [Recommended Safe Action]

steps.name: Step 1
steps.details:
Step 1

Job Briefing. Complete a risk/task assessment following local policy.

steps.name: Step 2
steps.details:
Step 2

Place Blue Flag Protection and Derails and/or Lock Switches per local procedures. Isolate Locomotive, Apply Parking Brake and Shutdown Engine. Center reverser. [Prevent coupling into by another Locomotive, proper body position and proper hand protection.]

steps.name: Step 3
steps.details:
Step 3

Before replacement of a coolant pressure sensor, follow the steps in ‘BP07-086 Sensor EMDEC Trouble Shooting’ to verify that the pressure sensor is faulty and needs to be replaced.

steps.name: Step 4
steps.details:
Step 4

In order to SAFELY perform this task, the cooling temperature of the system MUST be lowered to 120 F (49C) or lower.

  • This can be accomplished by running the Cooling Fan Self-Test while the engine is running until them temperature drops below 120F (49C).

steps.name: Step 5
steps.details:
Step 5

Once the unit is properly locked out and secured, verify and/or perform the following actions prior to starting the Field Test steps:

  1. Ensure reverser is centered
  2. Locomotive is isolated
  3. Parking brake is applied
  4. Engine is shutdown
  5. All circuit breakers are turned off in the proper order (all within the cab and the Electrical Locker
  6. Battery knife switch is opened and isolated. Ensure proper hand protection is used.

steps.name: Step 6
steps.details:
Step 6

Ensure that the coolant has drained out of the radiators and that the coolant sight glass is full.

Note: This may take a few minutes for the water to drain out of the radiators.

steps.name: Step 9
steps.details:
Step 9

COOLANT PRESSURE ‘ENGINE IN’ SENSOR REPLACEMENT

WARNING: The ‘Engine In’ sensor is under pressure. The Radiator Vent Handle must be open and the proper PPE must be worn to change this sensor.

steps.name: Step 10
steps.details:
Step 10

Disconnect the ‘engine in’ sensor plug from the engine sensor harness.

steps.name: Step 12
steps.details:
Step 12

Have the replacement coolant pressure sensor ready with thread sealant on sensor threads.

steps.name: Step 13
steps.details:
Step 13

Unplug the ‘engine in” sensor and using a standard 1-1/16 open end wrench.

steps.name: Step 14
steps.details:
Step 14

Install the ‘engine in’ sensor.

steps.name: Step 16
steps.details:
Step 16

COOLANT PRESSURE ‘ENGINE OUT’ SENSOR REPLACEMENT

WARNING: The water must be drained out of the radiators before the ‘Engine Out’ sensor is replaced.

steps.name: Step 18
steps.details:
Step 18

Disconnect the ‘engine out’ sensor plug from the engine sensor harness.

steps.name: Running Checks And Inspections
steps.details: Running Checks And Inspections

steps.name: Step 19
steps.details:
Step 19

Have the replacement coolant pressure sensor ready with thread sealant on sensor threads.

steps.name: Step 20
steps.details:
Step 20

Install the ‘engine out’ sensor.

steps.name: Step 22
steps.details:
Step 22

Lower and latch shut the engine gull wind doors.

steps.name: Step 23
steps.details:
Step 23

AFTER SENSOR REPLACEMENT

steps.name: Step 24
steps.details:
Step 24

Close the radiator vent handle.

steps.name: Step 25
steps.details:
Step 25

Top the unit up with coolant.

steps.name: Step 26
steps.details:
Step 26

At this point you will need to:

  • Close battery knife switch
  • Close all circuit breakers

Start the Engine

steps.name: Step 27
steps.details:
Step 27

Monitor the coolant sensor pressure in load test to make sure it works correctly. Monitor the WPEGILP and WPEGOTP signals in every throttle position to ensure the sensor is changing with each throttle position change.

Table 1: EM2000 Signals to Monitor EM2000 Signal
WPEgILP Water Pressure Engine-In Left bank PSI. This feedback originates at EMDEC’s Coolant Pressure-LB sensor. Pressure is monitored between the jacket water pump outlet and the engine.6 psi (42 KPa)60-75 psi (420-525 KPa)
WPEgOtP Water Pressure Engine-Out PSI. This feedback originates at EMDEC’s Coolant Pressure-Engine- Out / pump-in sensor. Pressure is monitored between the engine outlet and the radiators.4 psi (28 KPa)25-35 psi (175-245 KPa)

steps.name: Step 28
steps.details:
Step 28

Verify there are no water leaks at the sensors.

steps.name: Running Checks And Inspections
steps.details:
Text Image Text Image

Monitor the coolant sensor pressure in load test to make sure it works correctly. Monitor the WPEGILP and WPEGOTP signals in every throttle position to ensure the sensor is changing with each throttle position change.
